definitions.example: I’ve been pushing this rock as hard as I can, but it won’t budge an inch.
I’ve been pushing this rock as hard as I can, but I can’t budge it.

definitions.definition: To yield in one’s opinions or beliefs.
definitions.example: The Minister for Finance refused to budge on the new economic rules.

definitions.definition: (Minnesota, Wisconsin, Iowa) To cut or butt (in line); to join the front or middle rather than the back of a queue.
definitions.example: Hey, no budging! Don't budge in line!

definitions.definition: To try to improve the spot of a decision on a sports field.
A kind of fur prepared from lambskin dressed with the wool on, formerly used as an edging and ornament, especially on scholastic habits.
